Dead by Daylight is a story of an incredibly cool concept for a game absolutely ruined by the developers. 4 survivors, 1 killer. Survivors work together to repair generators so they can escape, killers try to sacrifice the survivors. Asymmetrical horror at its finest, right?

Massive flaws become apparent very easily in the execution of this concept, however. Part of the idea of this being a "horror" game is the thought that the survivors can only run or hide - there's nothing you can directly do to resist the killer, that should be obvious right? Except that's not at all the case. Toolboxes repair generators faster than your bare hands, but also can destroy the sacrificial hooks the killer needs to put up the survivors - so quickly that a common strategy is to do so directly in front of a killer who's carrying a survivor. Medkits are supposed to make sure you're at tip-top shape so you don't go down in one hit, but can also (in some circumstances) be used to instantly give yourself a free pass to get hit by the killer with no major downside beyond taking slightly longer to heal up afterwards. Flashlights blind the killer to give you time to get away, but also cause the killer to drop any survivor they're carrying, meaning a coordinated team of survivors with flashlights never needs to worry about actually getting sacrificed. And keys - while admittedly relatively rare - serve as a complete get-out-of-jail-free card for survivors, allowing them to unlock a hatch and escape even before repairing all the necessary generators. 

In addition, survivors and killers get "perks," that affect their playstyle/gameplay a good bit. Killer perks generally boil down to getting a slight advantage in highly specific scenarios - "the first generator you break within x seconds of putting a survivor on a hook instantly loses 25% progress" being one of the best ones available currently. The best killer perks are the ones that equate to slowing down survivor generator progress, since the longer the survivors are in the match with you, the more likely you are to find and chase them down, in addition to the fact that the base speed of repairing generators is actually quite fast. Very few of these perks exist for killer (and most of those that do have been heavily nerfed since their introduction because the developers don't want killers to have fun) and because of how the perk system works, require you to get multiple different killers out of the store and/or earn currency by increasing your player level and hope that the perk you need shows up in the "shrine of secrets" which only has 2 killer perks at a time and resets once per week.

Meanwhile, survivor perks have a strong tendency to equate to "get away from the killer for free." Dead Hard (a dash with temporary immunity to damage), Sprint Burst (you run extremely fast, much faster than the killer, for 3 seconds when you first start running, letting you open up a huge lead even if the killer is right behind you), Balanced Landing (falling from a height, instead of slowing you down, allows you to run at significantly increased speed for a few seconds), Head On (jumping out of a locker right in front of the killer stuns them for several seconds; this can be done while the killer is initiating their animation to grab you out of the locker), Borrowed Time (saving a survivor from a sacrificial hook within a certain distance of the killer gives the survivor you're saving the ability to take an extra hit without going down), Spine Chill (the perk icon lights up and you get an auditory notification when the killer is looking in your direction within a large distance, including through walls), and even with this new update they added yet another ridiculously powerful survivor perk, Deception (interacting with a locker while sprinting will generate the noise as though you had gotten into the locker, and also temporarily make it so you don't leave scratches while sprinting, making it look to the killer like you've gotten into the locker when actually you ran away with no trace). 

In short, the gameplay is so massively tilted in favor of survivor victory that playing killer isn't worth it, because even if you do manage to down a survivor on the maps that are specifically constructed to give said survivor every chance to get away from you, chances are either they'll get insta-healed with a medkit, someone will flashlight you when you pick them up and force you to drop them, or you won't be able to get them on a hook before they escape because the hook will be sabotaged. The horror aspect is massively undercut by the fact that the survivors know that they will in all likelihood be able to get out alive. And don't even get me started on survive with friends, a system that allows whole parties of survivors - often communicating via an out-of-game voice chat as voice chat is not available in-game - to play together and coordinate, preventing the killer from, well, really doing anything because the survivors, who are already quite powerful, are now coordinating to an unintended degree. Although, can it be called an unintended degree when the developers specifically allow survive with friends groups to go into ranked matches?

If you're going to play as survivor - very few people are still actively playing killer, so be prepared to wait 15min (or more) for a match because even with only needing 1 killer for every 4 survivors there aren't enough killer players to go around. If you're going to play killer - it's fun for about your first 3 or 4 matches, but as soon as you go up against survivors who have any clue how to actually play the game, or a survive with friends group, there's very little point to even touching your keyboard, and you'll soon see why very few people still play killer.

Nearly 300 hours in the game, watching it get more and more unbalanced with each and every update, even after recently buying some DLC for this game - I'm giving up.

Dead By Daylight is fun with friends for a couple of hours until you take a step back and realize that the gameplay could use heavy improvements due to the monotonous task of repairing generators and escaping. This type of gameplay is suited for mobile and the funny thing is that its free on mobile like it was meant to be. In all seriousness this game has had 4 years to improve and the only thing that the devs are doing is pushing out downloadable content like no tomorrow. Its pretty scummy just to reskin the game to this extent with no further improvement. Its like among us with better graphics, if you are in to that kind of games then by all means by this game 🙂.
